eu.wauz.wauzcore.players.calc

Class RageCalculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.wauz.wauzcore.players.calc.RageCalculator

  • public class RageCalculator
extends java.lang.Object
    Used to calculate the amount of rage a player has. Can also check if a player has enough rage for a skill.
    Author:
    Wauzmons
    See Also:
    WauzPlayerDataSectionStats.getRage()

    • Method Detail

      • generateRage

        public static void generateRage(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Adds a rage point to the given player. Capped at their current maximum.
        Parameters:
        player - The player who should receive rage.
        See Also:
        generateRage(Player, int)

      • generateRage

        public static void generateRage(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                                int amount)
        Adds multiple rage points to the given player. Capped at their current maximum.
        Parameters:
        player - The player who should receive rage.
        amount - The amount of rage to give.
        See Also:
        WauzPlayerDataSectionStats.setRage(int), WauzPlayerDataSectionStats.getMaxRage(), WauzPlayerActionBar.update(Player)

      • degenerateRage

        public static void degenerateRage(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Decreases the player's rage by one point. Capped at 0 points.
        Parameters:
        player - The player who should lose rage.
        See Also:
        WauzPlayerDataSectionStats.setRage(int), WauzPlayerActionBar.update(Player)

      • useRage

        public static boolean useRage(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                              int amount)
        Determines if a player has enough rage for something. If true, the rage is used up. If false, a message is shown to the player.
        Parameters:
        player - The player that tries to spend rage.
        amount - The needed amount of rage.
        Returns:
        If the player had enough rage.
        See Also:
        WauzPlayerDataSectionStats.getRage(), WauzPlayerActionBar.update(Player)
